responsibilities: developing state-of-the-art algorithms for detecting and removing artifacts in high-resolution multimodal neuroimaging datasets in collaboration with clinicians and researchers
developing the autonomous communications medical ecosystem (acme) - a dod-funded passive sensor suite that uses video, audio, and motion capture sensors to automatically document casualty care
building electronic medical record (emr) software for healthcare providers in developing countries using multimodal ai to automate the digitization of historical medical records
raised $25_000 in funding through competitive pitch competitions
developed data integration pipelines for joint analysis of spatial transcriptomics and single cell rna-seq data
trained and evaluated machine learning models to predict carcinogenicity initiationg events for target molecules using transcriptional profiles and chemical structures
built and deployed internal tools for running statistical analyses and biomarker discovery on high-content imaging datasets using dask, dash and flask
trained, evaluated and deployed machine learning models for biomarker identification in toxicology studies
implemented noise2void and cellpose to improve the performance of automated image segmentation and feature extraction pipelines
developed statistical models analyzing immune responses in covid-19 patients through comprehensive analysis of serum, urinary, and neurological biomarkers
developed tools to automate the ingestion, quality control, and analysis of data from elisa and next generation sequencing assays
